result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brian Marvin Meyer

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on November 9, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Matter set for a P/S on 10/07/2022 at 9:00 a.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 7, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Order to Quash Warrant filed by the State (sent to Br 2 Judge on 04/06/22 sp)
Motion to Quash Warrant filed by the State (sent to Br 2 Judge on 04/06/22 sp)
Do not possess/consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription.

2:19 PM Prosecuting attorney Andrew Mutchler in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Brian Marvin Meyer in court. 

Atty Mutchler requests to quash the warrant. 
BY THE COURT:  Court has not signed the warrant so that is vacated.  

Defendant did not receive a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court prints a copy for the defendant and the bailiff provides that to him. 
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Defendant waives reading of the complaint.

Court advises defendant of right to counsel/public defender representation.
Defendant states he was over the limit and is not eligible for the public defender. 
Court informs the defendant to obtain a petition for indigency thru the Branch 3 office. 

NOT GUILTY plea(s) entered by the court on the defendant's behalf.

Court informs the defendant that is a mandatory appearance at the pre-trial whether he is represented or not. 
Defendant makes statements to the court. 

State recommends a $250 signature bond with conditions as stated.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 16, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on May 16, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Return on warrant/Initial appearance on April 4, 2022 at 02:15 pm.

1:56 PM Prosecuting attorney Andrew Mutchler in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Brian Marvin Meyer not in court. 

Atty Mutchler requests a warrant with a $500 cash alternative and makes statements regarding service. 
Court makes statements regarding the summons and adjournment request. 

BY THE COURT: 
Warrant with a $500 cash alternative.
Adjourned initial appearance on April 4, 2022 at 01:45 pm.

02:06 PM Defendant Brian Marvin Meyer not in court. Prosecuting Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Kelly A Cassidy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Atty Cassidy indicates the defendant contact their office and indicated he is sick but provided no other information.  Requests to adjourn. 
  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 4, 2022 at 01:45 pm.
Initial Appearance set for February 28, 2022 @ 1:45 p.m. in Br 1
